s.text: As the one who led the team debating Ashford and Mortimer, whose 2002 article [2] supports this statement, at the 2001 conference on Alzheimer disease (AD) in Cincinnati (ÒChallenging Views of Alzheimer's DiseaseÓ) [3], I think that the evidence that dietary and lifestyle factors explain the majority of the individual risk for AD in the US is very strong.
If genetics were the primary risk factor, those living in the US would have a risk of developing AD very similar to that of individuals living in their ancestral home.
